text: Karl Guthe Jansky (October 22, 1905 â€“ February 14, 1950) was an American physicist and engineer. He worked in astronomy. In 1927, he discovered that the Milky Way emitted radio waves. This makes him one of the founding fathers of radio astronomy. Category:1905 births Category:1950 deaths Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Oklahoma
title: Karl Guthe Jansky
